sourceDesc:
<<<<<<< HEAD
The nevve and admirable arte of setting of corne with all the necessarie tooles and other circumstances belonging to the same: the particular titles whereof, are set downe in the page following. Plat, Hugh, Sir, 1552-1611?
[32] p.
By Peter Short, dwelling at the figure of the Starre on Bredstreet hill, Imprinted at London : 1600.
By Sir Hugh Plat. Signatures: A-D⁴. "A2r line 1 of text ends: "probablie", line 3 has "new"; C1r line 7 of text ends "cause", line 11 has "wormes"."--STC. With woodcut title vignette. Another edition of STC 19993. Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
=======
The nevve and admirable arte of setting of corne with all the necessarie tooles and other circumstances belonging to the same: the particular titles whereof, are set downe in the page following. Plat, Hugh, Sir, 1552-1611?
[32] p.
By Peter Short, dwelling at the figure of the Starre on Bredstreet hill, Imprinted at London : 1600.
By Sir Hugh Plat. Signatures: A-D⁴. "A2r line 1 of text ends: "probablie", line 3 has "new"; C1r line 7 of text ends "cause", line 11 has "wormes"."--STC. With woodcut title vignette. Another edition of STC 19993. Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
Peter Short
the figure of the Starre on Bredstreet hill
